title: JOIN_OBJECT
description: Returns records from a specified object connected via the given connection, filtered by matching field-value pairs, with an optional additional filtering clause.

parameters.name: connection_name
parameters.description: The name of the connection to use.

parameters.name: object_name
parameters.description: The name of the object from which records are retrieved.

parameters.name: … matching_field_name
parameters.description: The field name to match for filtering records. Multiple pairs allowed. Left Join if any pairs are included; Cross Join if all are omitted.

parameters.name: … matching_field_value
parameters.description: The field value used as a filter criterion.

parameters.name: additional_clause_optional
parameters.description: An additional query clause for more specific filtering.

examples:
JOIN_OBJECT(
            "Current", 
            "Opportunity",
            "AccountId", Id, 
            "IsClosed = true"
)
-- Performs a left join with Opportunity records where AccountId matches the current record’s Id, filtered by IsClosed = true.

JOIN_OBJECT(
            "$Source", 
            "Opportunity",
            "AccountId", Id, 
            "IsClosed = true"
)
-- Performs a left join from the $Source record to Opportunity records where AccountId matches the current record’s Id, filtered by IsClosed = true.

JOIN_OBJECT(
            "$Target", 
            "Opportunity", 
            "AccountId", Id, 
            "OwnerId", OwnerId, 
            "FiscalYear = 2024"
)
-- Performs a left join from the $Target record to Opportunity records where AccountId and OwnerId match the current record’s Id and OwnerId, filtered by FiscalYear = 2024.

tips.text: Defines this function during the Scoping stage to retrieve and prepare data for subsequent use in the Mapping stage.

Be careful to provide matching pairs when using this function. Omitting matching criteria can result in cross joins, creating excessively large record sets. Follow Salesforce best practices to prevent exceeding system limits.
For the connection_name parameter, you can use relative connections: $Source or $Target.
